headline.main: ROOSEVELT WAITS FOR VICHY MOVES; Indicates No Break Is Planned Now, but Washington Is Watching With Concern HULL ASSEMBLING FACTS Nazi Troop Transit Through France to French North Africa Believed Projected

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 -- A definite indication was given by President Roosevelt at his press conference today that the United States did not intend to sever diplomatic relations with France, at least for the present, as a result of the dismissal of General Maxime Weygand as commander in North Africa.
abstract: Roosevelt says no break with France is planned now as result of Weygand dismissal

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST AREAS
